captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are gonna be making something I got
so many requests for!
We’re gonna be making Deadpool Cupcakes!

And they’re really, really yummy, I’m
gonna be making maple cupcakes so that

they kind of taste like pancakes. I thought
that that would be perfect!
So, let’s get started!

The things you will need to make Maple Cupcakes
is gonna be: Baking powder,

salt, vanilla extract, maple syrup, buttercream,
flour, brown sugar,
2 large eggs, and 1/2 a cup of butter!

You’ll also need a whisk, a cupcake tray,
I’ve lined them with these little

cupcake liners, very handy! 2 big mixing bowls,
and, electric beater!
Let’s put it all together.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is take
1 of your big mixing bowls and

we are gonna combine some of our dry ingredients.
First you’re gonna pour

in 1-1/2 cups of all purpose flour. Then you’re
gonna put in… 1 Teaspoon of

baking powder. And then you’re gonna put
in a 1/4 a teaspoon of salt.

Then you’re gonna take a whisk and whisk
it all together, until it’s all evenly combined!

Now in your other big bowl we are gonna cream
our butter and sugar.

So you’re gonna take 2/3 cup of brown sugar,
and 1/2 a cup of butter,
which is 1 sh-tick of butter.

Now take your electric beater, and beat until
everything is very
light and fluffy.

Once the mixture’s all light and fluffy
you’re gonna add your eggs,

1 at a time. So add the first egg, and then
you’ll mix it together.
And then add your second egg!

Now you’re gonna add 1 teaspoon of vanilla
extract.

Now we’re gonna pour in our liquids, this
is 1/3 cup of buttermilk. And then
you’re gonna use 1/3 cup of maple syrup!

These are so yummy! They actually taste like
pancakes!

This is 1 of my favorite cupcake recipes,
so good! If you like pancakes!

Now you’re gonna slowly mix in your dry
ingredients.

Add a little bit, and then mix, and then add a little
bit and then mix!

Once your batter is all combined, you’re
just gonna take this little tablespoon scooper.

And I like to scoop 2 tablespoons into these
little cupcake trays.
So there’s 1… And 2!

You want to make sure that your cupcake is
2/3 full, it will have plenty of room

to rise in the oven then. And you’re just
gonna fill in all your little cupcake trays.
And your whole house is gonna smell like pancakes!

Once you got your cupcakes trays full, you’re
gonna heat your oven to 350

and bake for 18 minutes. And when those are
baking, we’re gonna make some mini pancakes.

So we’re gonna head over to the oven and
start making some pancakes for decoration!

We’re here in the kitchen, and I’m gonna
make little pancakes to decorate the top

of the cupcakes. Um, the recipe that I am
using is old fashioned pancake recipe.

It’s the same recipe I used for the Rilakuma
pancakes. So I’ll put the link here if you
want to check it out.
Meh!?!

And what you’re gonna do is just take your medium
pan, put it on the stovetop, put it on

a low to medium heat, on my stove its a 3,
so I've just put it on a 3.

And you’re gonna take a little teaspoon,
and you’re gonna scoop some batter, and then

pour little circles into the pan to make the
mini pancakes.

You only have to leave your little mini pancakes
on there for a few seconds. Because

they’re so little they bake very quickly. As soon
as they start bubbling you’ll know it’s
ready to flip!

You can make as many as you want, they make
really good snacks. And, you can make

as many to fill a whole swimming pool. Because
Domino will appreciate it!

And I will appreciate it. These are pretty
good!

Now to decorate our little cupcakes, to make
the tops of the sword katanas, what we’re

gonna do is take a pretzel, and wrap it and
decorate it in black fondant. Just

like these little guys right here. I got this
design idea from The Girl Online.

She bakes, she does a lot of fondant work.
Her website is called Nerd Ache Cake

and I’ll put a link down below so you can
go check it out.

But it was so cute! And I was like, I’ve
gotta spread and share this idea, it’s so cool!
So what you’re gonna do, is…

Take a little pretzel, just a teeny little
pretzel, and, roll out some black fondant.

And then you’re gonna roll your little pretzel
in the black fondant.

Cut off the excess. Then to make it thin I’m
just pulling the fondant back to get all

the excess off. And then you’re gonna cut
a little square, and stick that on the top.

And then cut 2 thin pieces, and you’re just
gonna wrap them around the pretzel.

Once your cupcakes are done baking, you’re
just gonna take them out of the oven,

and make sure that they’ve had plenty of
time to cool, I like to wait about 20 minutes.

And, what we’re gonna do is peel 1 of the
cupcakes. And I’m just gonna use it’s little

wrapper. Flip it upside down, and then I’m
going to shave it just a little bit on each

side. Then take a toothpick, put it right
down the middle, mewp!
Then put this right on top.

Now that we’ve got our cupcakes basic shape,
I’m gonna frost the cupcakes!

For the pancake ones I’m using a maple buttercream
frosting, and we’re just gonna

put a little bit on top, like this, weee-ooop!
Make a circle.

And then you’re gonna take a stack of 3
pancakes, stick ‘em on top. Oh they look
so good!

And to make it look like butter, I’m gonna
take banana Laffy Taffys and cut 2 little
squares to put them on top.
What do you get when you mix paint together?
A mess…

Now we’re gonna frost our Mr. Wade cupcakes,
our Deadpool cupcakes with red frosting.

This is just a red buttercream frosting. And
I’m gonna start on the outside and then
work my way up.

Now you’re just gonna do this to the rest
of your cupcakes and we’re gonna add all
the little fondant details!
Ta-da!

Here are our Deadpool cupcakes, I hope that
you guys liked ‘em! Thanks for suggesting

it, these were really fun to make. I love
maple cupcakes from scratch!

They taste so good! They taste just like pancakes!
And, another thank you to

Nerd Ache Cakes, I’ll put her link again
down below because she inspired these red

guys, little Deadpools! Little Wade’s in
the back.

You can also follow me on Facebook, Instagram,
Twitter and Tumblr, I have a lot of

fan baking creation pictures there, feel free
to send me pictures, I love posting them!

And, if you have any ideas for any other Nerdy
Nummies, please let me know, leave me a

comment down below and I will do my best to
make it happen!
Thanks you guys! Bye-bye!

Once your batter’s all mixed, we’re just
gonna scoop…
Hee-hee

Rhymes with poop… I’m so sorry, OK, here
we go, here we go!
I’m just so sorry!

title: HOW TO MAKE DEADPOOL CUPCAKES - NERDY NUMMIES
